intro: Ditoxia betonicifolia, commonly known as the sweet-smelling bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and herbal practices.
